title: Zelenskyy meeting European leaders in Denmark to rally support for Ukraine
summary: Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen says that Europe is in a hybrid war waged by Russia, and Ukraine is first line of defence.

title: Israel threatens all staying in Gaza City, kills at least 13 in enclave
summary: Israeli Defence Minister Katz says anyone who stays in Gaza City will be considered 'terrorists and terror supporters'.

title: Schools and airport shut as Hurricane Imelda moves over Bermuda
summary: Bermuda deploys soldiers to secure infrastructure, clear roads and help at emergency shelters.

title: South Korea president apologises for abusive foreign adoption scheme
summary: Programme, which started after Korean War as a way of removing mixed-race children from society, violated human rights.

title: US government shutdown continues, as Trump cuts funds for Democratic states
summary: Republicans and Democrats fail to narrow differences on spending bill, as effects of shutdown start showing.

title: How the world is responding to Israel’s interception of the Gaza flotilla
summary: Italian unions call for general strike as global protests grow and multiple governments criticise Israel.

title: Yasin Malik, Kashmir’s best-known separatist, an Indian intelligence asset?
summary: In an affidavit whose contents have gripped India, Malik claims he worked with multiple Indian prime ministers, agents.

title: FBI cuts ties with Anti-Defamation League amid conservative backlash
summary: FBI Director Kash Patel announces break with anti-Semitism watchdog amid outrage over description of Charlie Kirk.

title: Israel intercepts Gaza Sumud flotilla vessels: What we know so far
summary: Global Sumud Flotilla had been pressing forward with its mission to break Israel's siege of Gaza.

title: Israeli forces board Gaza flotilla, detain Greta Thunberg, other activists
summary: At least six ships have been boarded by the Israeli navy so far and more interceptions are expected to take place.

title: Israel kills journalist Yahia Barzaq known for his newborn baby portraits
summary: An Israeli air strike has killed journalist Yahia Barzaq, who was known for his creative portraits of newborn children.

title: Ethiopia church scaffolding collapse kills 36 during religious festival
summary: Pilgrims were visiting the Menjar Shenkora Arerti Mariam Church to mark the annual Virgin Mary festival.

title: Flottille pour Gaza : Israël annonce l'expulsion en Europe des passagers interceptés
summary: Israël a annoncé, jeudi, l'expulsion vers l'Europe de tous les passagers qui se trouvaient à bord des navires de la flottille vers Gaza, interceptés par les forces navales israéliennes la veille.

title: La flotille pour Gaza est-elle financée par le Hamas comme l'affirme Israël ?
summary: Israël a rendu public des documents du Hamas qui prouveraient la flotille Sumud pour Gaza est financée par le groupe terroriste. En réalité, rien ne confirme ces accusations mais des liens existent bien entre certains membres de la flotille et le mouvement islamiste.

title: Plan Trump pour Gaza : une amnistie à prendre ou à laisser pour le Hamas ?
summary: Depuis l’annonce du plan de paix de Donald Trump pour Gaza, tous les regards sont tournés vers le Hamas, à qui le président américain a donné "trois ou quatre jours" pour répondre. En échange d’une amnistie, le groupe islamiste est sommé de se plier aux exigences américaines et de renoncer à gouverner le territoire côtier palestinien.

title: La flottille pour Gaza poursuit sa route malgré des "intimidations" et des appels à s'arrêter
summary: La flottille humanitaire qui se dirige vers Gaza a annoncé mercredi matin être entrée dans une zone à haut risque et faire face à des "intimidations" attribuées à Israël.

title: Vives réactions après l'interception de la flottille pour Gaza par Israël
summary: Plusieurs bateaux de la flottille pour Gaza ont été interceptés mercredi par les forces navales israéliennes. Le Hamas dénonce "un crime de piraterie et de terrorisme maritime". En France, le chef de la diplomatie Jean-Noël Barrot a appelé les autorités israéliennes "à assurer la sécurité des participants". La Colombie a décidé, en guise de riposte, d'expulser la délégation diplomatique israélienne. Voici le fil du 1er octobre 2025.

title: La flottille pour Gaza à l'approche de la zone interdite par Israël
summary: La frégate italienne accompagnant la flottille humanitaire en direction de Gaza va cesser sa mission à l'approche des côtes, a annoncé Rome, qui veut éviter un "incident diplomatique" avec Israël. Si le convoi de plus de 40 bateaux, parti de Barcelone pour l'enclave palestinienne, poursuit sa route, ses organisateurs craignent une "attaque" de l'État hébreu dans les heures à venir.

title: Ce jihadiste qui brandit deux têtes décapitées n’est pas le président syrien Ahmed al-Charaa
summary: Alors que le président syrien s’est exprimé mercredi à l’ONU, des internautes partagent une photographie censée montrer Ahmed al-Chaara en train de commettre un crime de guerre, alors qu’il était encore un leader jihadiste. On le verrait brandir deux têtes décapitées. En réalité, l’homme sur la photo est un jihadiste australien.

title: Plan Trump pour Gaza : à l’épreuve du réel ? Parlons-en avec E. Danon, O. Bronchtein et A. Arefi
summary: Nous nous intéressons au plan pour Gaza présenté lundi par le président américain Donald Trump au Hamas comme une proposition à prendre ou à laisser pour mettre fin à une guerre qui a fait plus de 66 000 morts. Un plan qui laisse une infinité de questions sans réponses sur l’avenir politique et sécuritaire de l’enclave comme celui d’Israël mais aussi sur celui de la Cisjordanie. Un plan – accompagné d’une myriade de superlatifs dans la bouche du président américain – qui vient se confronter au réel. Que dit ce réel ? Questions posées à Éric Danon, ancien ambassadeur de France en Israël, Ofer Bronchtein, président et co-fondateur du Forum International pour la Paix et Armin Arefi, grand reporter au Point et spécialiste du Moyen-Orient.

title: Plan de paix pour Gaza : Donald Trump lance un ultimatum au Hamas
summary: Le président américain Donald Trump a donné mardi "trois ou quatre jours" au Hamas pour répondre à sa proposition de plan de paix pour Gaza. De son côté, le Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu a semblé revenir sur l'une des principales dispositions du plan, en affirmant que l'armée israélienne resterait "dans la majeure partie de la bande de Gaza".

title: L'ONU appelle "toutes les parties" à accepter le plan de Trump pour Gaza
summary: Alors que Donald Trump a prévenu mardi que le Hamas avait "trois ou quatre jours" pour répondre à son plan pour Gaza, le secrétaire général de l'ONU Antonio Guterres a appelé "toutes les parties" à accepter la proposition du président américain. Voici le fil du 30 septembre 2025.

title: Ce que contient le plan de paix de Donald Trump pour Gaza
summary: Le président américain Donald Trump a proposé lundi un plan en 20 points pour mettre fin à la guerre à Gaza entre Israël et le Hamas et au-delà sur l'avenir du territoire palestinien. Voici ce qu'il faut retenir.

title: Plan Trump pour Gaza : soutien sous conditions de Netanyahu, la réponse du Hamas se fait attendre
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu a apporté lundi son soutien sous conditions au plan de paix de Donald Trump pour Gaza. Huit pays arabes et musulmans ainsi que l'Autorité palestinienne ont salué "les efforts" du président américain, tandis que le Hamas n'a pas encore répondu.

title: Le Venezuela prêt à décréter l’état d’urgence pour faire face aux menaces américaines
summary: Craignant une escalade militaire avec les Etats-Unis, qui, depuis six semaines, multiplient les démonstrations de force au large du Venezuela en prétextant la lutte contre le narcotrafic, le président Nicolas Maduro a pris des mesures lui octroyant davantage de pouvoir si la pression devait s’intensifier.

title: Royaume-Uni : Keir Starmer exige une réponse « forte » de la police de Londres, après la diffusion d’un reportage de la BBC mettant en cause des agents
summary: Un reportage du journaliste britannique Rorri Bibb en caméra caché montre des agents londoniens qui tiennent des propos racistes, misogynes et islamophobes. Neuf d’entre eux ont été suspendus.

title: Plusieurs bateaux de la flottille pour Gaza interceptés par les forces israéliennes
summary: Faute d’être en capacité d’arrêter la totalité des près de 45 bateaux en route vers l’enclave palestinienne, l’Etat hébreu a arraisonné une vingtaine d’entre eux. Une victoire symbolique pour la Global Sumud qui cherche à « briser le blocus » du territoire.

title: Plan américain pour Gaza : les inquiétudes de la France
summary: Le quai d’Orsay souligne les « faiblesses » et les « risques » de la feuille de route concoctée par les Etats-Unis et Israël, notant que la création d’un Etat palestinien n’y apparaît que comme un horizon lointain et flou.

title: Les relations entre l’Ukraine et la Hongrie s’enveniment après des survols de drones
summary: Le président ukrainien, Volodymyr Zelensky, reproche notamment au premier ministre hongrois, Viktor Orban, d’avoir envoyé des drones au-dessus de l’Ukraine, qui pourraient servir la cause de l’ennemi russe.

title: Aux Philippines, le bilan du séisme s’alourdit à 72 morts
summary: Le gouvernement a fait savoir que 294 personnes avaient été blessées et environ 20 000 avaient fui leur domicile, après le tremblement de terre mardi de magnitude 6,9.

title: La Corée du Sud reconnaît pour la première fois sa responsabilité dans des adoptions abusives de dizaines de milliers d’enfants
summary: Après la guerre de Corée, qui a pris fin en 1953, plus de 140 000 enfants ont été envoyés à l’étranger à des fins d’adoption entre 1955 et 1999, pour éloigner les enfants métis nés de mère coréenne et de père soldat américain dans un pays qui prône l’homogénéité ethnique.

title: Gaza, Ukraine : la paix est-elle encore possible ?
summary: A l’occasion du Festival du Monde, le 21 septembre, l’ancien ambassadeur Gérard Araud et la géopolitologue Rym Momtaz se sont interrogés sur les suites possibles de ces deux conflits au regard de l’histoire.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Volodymyr Zelensky attendu à Copenhague pour un sommet européen
summary: Le président ukrainien va rejoindre au Danemark des dizaines de dirigeants. Pour répondre à la menace russe, les Européens travaillent à la mise en œuvre d’un « mur » antidrones, et comptent sur l’expertise de l’Ukraine pour les y aider.

title: En Grèce, les premiers objets de l’épave du « Britannic », jumeau du « Titanic », refont surface
summary: L’épave du paquebot, qui servait d’hôpital pendant la première guerre mondiale et a fait naufrage en Grèce en 1916, a été fouillée par des archéologues pour la première fois.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : soixante-sept personnes ont été tuées depuis l’aube dans la bande de Gaza, rapporte l’agence de presse palestinienne WAFa
summary: L’armée israélienne a par ailleurs annoncé mercredi avoir pris le contrôle du corridor de Netzarim, isolant un peu plus la ville de Gaza, où la Croix-Rouge ne peut plus intervenir.

title: Aux Etats-Unis, les agents de l’ICE, visages masqués de la politique migratoire de Donald Trump
summary: Forte de ses 20 000 fonctionnaires, la police de l’immigration américaine multiplie les descentes musclées dans tout le pays, agissant souvent au mépris des droits des personnes interpellées.

title: Spain condemns Israeli raid on Gaza aid flotilla
summary:
Spain condemns Israeli raid on Gaza aid flotilla

Spain’s labour minister and deputy prime minister, Yolanda Díaz, has condemned Israel’s raid on the Gaza aid flotilla as “a crime against international law” and demanded the immediate release of those detained.

Writing on Bluesky, Díaz added: “The EU needs to break off relations with Israel right now.”

Spain’s foreign ministry issued a statement late on Wednesday, highlighting that the flotilla was “a peaceful and humanitarian civil society initiative” and calling for the “physical integrity and rights” of Spanish citizens onboard to be respected. The statement concluded: “Spain will continue to demand an end to the war in Gaza, the massive entry of humanitarian aid, the release of all Israeli hostages, and the implementation of the two-state solution: Palestine and Israel, living side by side in peace and security.”

title: Brazil condemns Israeli interception of Gaza aid flotilla
summary:
Brazil condemns Israeli interception of Gaza aid flotilla

Brazil has condemned Israel after its navy intercepted a flotilla carrying humanitarian aid to Gaza, which included several Brazilian nationals and a lawmaker.

The Foreign Ministry said in a statement that Brasilia “deplores the Israeli government’s military action, which violates rights and endangers the physical well-being of peaceful protesters”. It added: “The responsibility for the safety of those detained now rests with Israel.”

Foreign Minister Mauro Vieira said his government had communicated “directly” with Israel over concerns for the 15 Brazilians taking part in the flotilla, including legislator Luizianne Lins.

Brazil is among several countries worldwide urging Israel to lift restrictions on humanitarian aid entering the besieged Gaza Strip.

title: Pakistan and Turkey condemn Israeli raid on Gaza aid flotilla
summary:
Pakistan and Turkey condemn Israeli raid on Gaza aid flotilla

Pakistan has strongly condemned Israel’s interception of dozens of Gaza-bound boats in the Sumud Flotilla, describing it as a “dastardly attack”.

“We hope and pray for the safety of all those who have been illegally apprehended by Israeli forces and call for their immediate release. Their crime was to carry aid for the hapless Palestinian people,” Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said.

Turkey's Foreign Ministry also denounced the naval raid, calling it a “terrorist” act.

Earlier this week, flight tracking data showed Turkey, along with Spain, Italy and Greece, monitoring the flotilla’s journey.

title: Palestine is now the conscience of the world. No deal will change that
summary:
Palestine is now the conscience of the world. No deal will change that

Submitted by Soumaya Ghannoushi on Wed, 10/01/2025 - 15:14
Dressed up as statesmanship, the Trump-Netanyahu proposal is nothing but an attempt to impose surrender
Pro-Palestinian activists protest in Madrid on 14 September 2025 (Oscar Del Pozo/AFP)
Off

What US President Donald Trump unveiled in Washington this week was not a peace plan, but a parody of one; a deal proclaimed as a breakthrough, yet negotiated between an American enabler and an Israeli perpetrator - with the very people whose fate it decides erased from the stage. 

Trump sat beaming beside Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, thanking him for “agreeing” to a plan he had written himself, while Palestinians were nowhere in the picture. No Hamas, no Palestinian Authority - not even a token presence to lend the charade a hint of credibility.

It continues the same colonial logic that birthed the Abraham Accords: strike deals over Palestine without Palestinians. Celebrate “peace” while ignoring occupation, blockade and ethnic cleansing. Parrot the language of reconciliation while systematically excluding the only people who have the right to speak for themselves.

This deal is not negotiation; it is imposition. It is surrender dressed up as statesmanship. 

Netanyahu has assassinated or attempted to kill negotiators before, from Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh to those targeted in Doha as they sat to discuss Trump’s draft deal. His policy has always been clear: eliminate the negotiators, eliminate the negotiations, and then stand beside Washington to announce a plan crafted by genocide partners.

To dignify this spectacle, a host of Arab and Muslim leaders were summoned - not to defend Palestinians, but to pressure them. Their assigned role is to serve as Trump and Netanyahu’s cover; their duty is not to shield Palestine, but to shove it towards submission. 

Netanyahu himself crowed in astonishment: “Who could believe it?” - that Muslim regimes would provide the fig leaf for Israel’s diktat.

Tide of public opinion

Strip away the theatre, and the plan is thin gruel. There’s one concrete item: the return of hostages. Everything else is smoke. No guarantees of withdrawal, no binding commitments - only vague promises, while Israeli troops remain entrenched. 

What Trump offered Netanyahu was not compromise, but victory: the very victory he failed to achieve by force, after two years of bombs and massacres.

Israel failed to crush Gaza. It failed to bring its hostages home by war. It failed to break Palestinian will. Trump’s deal is an attempt to turn defeat into triumph; to conjure through diplomacy what could not be won on the battlefield.

Follow Middle East Eye's live coverage of the Israel-Palestine war

But Israel is not triumphant; it is isolated. At the United Nations, Netanyahu stood at the podium while 77 delegations walked out, leaving him to declaim to empty chairs. Polls across Europe and the US show public opinion tilting decisively against Israel, with younger generations leading the shift. The tide of global solidarity with Palestine is swelling, and nothing terrifies Washington and Tel Aviv more.

That is the true aim of this deal: to break that tide. To smother the momentum of boycotts, protests and a rising global conscience. To replace Palestinian agency with an imposed guardianship, a “Board of Peace” chaired by Trump and overseen by Tony Blair - a man whose colonial delusions and blood-soaked record in Iraq disqualify him from administering a schoolyard, let alone the future of Gaza.

History will not be kind to this moment. A ceasefire plan that excludes the occupied is not a peace plan. It is a colonial diktat

This is not peace. It is the Gaza Humiliation Foundation writ large, the same machinery of external control, dressed up in humanitarian jargon. And the Muslim rulers who sit beside Netanyahu - from the Emiratis who whispered with him as the world turned away at the UN, to those now parading behind Trump’s podium - are not partners in peace. They are accomplices in surrender.

As Egypt’s former UN delegate Motaz Khalil put it, this is nothing but a “surrender plan”. It silences Palestinians, strips them of representation, and hands Netanyahu the absolute victory he promised and failed to win.

History will not be kind to this moment. A ceasefire plan that excludes the occupied is not a peace plan. It is a colonial diktat - the language of mandate and tutelage revived for the 21st century. It is the same conceit that promised away Palestinian land in their absence, without their consent, in the Balfour Declaration of 1917. Mandates, protectorates, trusteeships - all the euphemisms of empire are recycled to deny Palestinians their voice.

Trump and Netanyahu can draft as many plans as they please, but outside their conference rooms, the world is shifting. Millions march, boycotts deepen, public opinion tilts. The tide is turning, and no paper agreement can stem it. Palestine has become the conscience of the world - and that cannot be negotiated away.

The views expressed in this article belong to the author and do not necessarily reflect the editorial policy of Middle East Eye. 

Palestine state

title: Flotilla tracker shows Gaza-bound vessel enters territorial waters
summary:
Flotilla tracker shows Gaza-bound vessel enters territorial waters

The Global Sumud Flotilla’s live tracker shows that one of its boats, the Mikeno, has entered Gaza’s territorial waters.

Israeli naval forces continue to stop vessels heading towards the enclave, but several others are now approaching the coast. Organisers say 24 ships remain in operation.

The Mikeno ship, which had lost its signal, appeared inside Gaza’s territorial waters about 9.3 miles from Gaza pic.twitter.com/jC0wT7GUkr

— Global Sumud Flotilla Commentary (@GlobalSumudF) October 2, 2025

title: Israeli strikes killed at least 11 Palestinians in Gaza this morning
summary:
Israeli strikes killed at least 11 Palestinians in Gaza this morning

Israeli attacks on Gaza have killed at least 11 Palestinians in the morning hours, according to hospital officials and rescue teams speaking to Al Jazeera.

A child was killed by Israeli drone fire in the Ansar neighbourhood, west of Gaza City. In central Gaza, at least nine people were killed and 13 others wounded when Israeli forces struck a displacement camp. Another drone strike south of Deir el-Balah killed one person and injured at least 10 more.

Since Israel launched its war on Gaza in October 2023, at least 66,148 Palestinians have been killed and 168,716 wounded.

title: Israel orders all remaining Palestinians to leave Gaza City
summary:
Israel orders all remaining Palestinians to leave Gaza City

The Israeli government has issued an order for all Palestinians still in Gaza City to leave immediately.

Defence Minister Israel Katz warned it was their “last opportunity” to evacuate, adding that anyone who remained would be treated as a militant supporter and face the “full force” of Israel’s latest assault.

Since Israel began its push to seize Gaza City last month, around 400,000 Palestinians have fled. Yet, according to the Associated Press, hundreds of thousands more remain trapped — many unable to afford the journey south or too weak to leave famine-hit areas.

Katz repeated his warning in a post on X on Wednesday.

title: Hanan Ashrawi says Israel’s flotilla raid is piracy
summary:
Hanan Ashrawi says Israel’s flotilla raid is piracy

Hanan Ashrawi, the veteran Palestinian activist and former PLO executive committee member, has condemned Israel’s assault on the Gaza aid flotilla as a “criminal act of piracy” carried out in international waters.

Ashrawi hailed “those brave men and women” aboard the flotilla, saying they are standing up to Israel’s genocide and its unlawful blockade of Gaza.

“They’re putting their lives on the line by actively intervening [and] demonstrating the real meaning of solidarity [and] human empathy,” she said.

All eyes on the Sumud flotilla! https://t.co/LUDa5LF3O5

— Hanan Ashrawi (@DrHananAshrawi) October 1, 2025

title: Francesca Albanese says states with navies could break Israel’s siege on Gaza but choose not to
summary:
Francesca Albanese says states with navies could break Israel’s siege on Gaza but choose not to

Francesca Albanese, the UN special rapporteur on the occupied Palestinian territory, has criticised the failure of states to challenge Israel’s naval blockade of Gaza, where Israel faces accusations of genocide and deliberately starving civilians.

Pointing to the Global Sumud Flotilla, which has reached waters close to Gaza in small civilian boats, Albanese questioned why governments with powerful navies have not acted.

“If citizens of the world, travelling in small and underresourced boats, have been able to get to within 60 nautical miles (111km) of Gaza in a flotilla, why states don’t break the blockade with their navies?” she wrote on social media.

“Is this the world we live in? No, we do not accept it,” Albanese added, before wishing the flotilla safe passage: “Go, go Flotilla! Sail safe. God’s wind.”

60 nautical miles? Wow.

If ordinary citizens of the world, with small and underresourced boats can do that, why states don't break the blockade with their navies?

Is this the world we live in? No, we do not accept it.

Go, go Flotilla! Sail safe.
God's wind. https://t.co/sOjSBJNi87

— Francesca Albanese, UN Special Rapporteur oPt (@FranceskAlbs) October 1, 2025

title: Flotilla tracker shows 15 Gaza aid boats intercepted by Israel
summary:
Flotilla tracker shows 15 Gaza aid boats intercepted by Israel

The Global Sumud Flotilla says its tracker is showing which vessels are still heading towards Gaza and which have already been stopped. As of 3:48am GMT on Thursday, the tracker confirmed that 15 boats had been intercepted by Israeli forces.

In a statement, the flotilla said: “Beyond the confirmed interceptions, live streams and communications with several other vessels have been lost.”

Israeli forces intercepted the flotilla on Wednesday about 70 nautical miles off Gaza, after warning repeatedly that it was violating what they called a lawful blockade. Among those stopped was the vessel carrying climate activist Greta Thunberg.

title: If you’re just joining us
summary:
If you’re just joining us

In case you’re just joining us, here’s what happened overnight as Israel moved against the Gaza aid flotilla:

  • Israeli forces intercepted multiple boats from the Global Sumud Flotilla in the Mediterranean on Wednesday and took passengers to an Israeli port. The flotilla had set out to break Israel’s blockade of Gaza.

  • Footage released by Israel’s foreign ministry and verified by Reuters showed climate activist Greta Thunberg surrounded by armed soldiers on one of the boats. She is the most high-profile passenger on board.

  • Israel’s foreign ministry wrote on X: “Several vessels of the Hamas-Sumud flotilla have been safely stopped and their passengers are being transferred to an Israeli port. Greta and her friends are safe and healthy.”

  • The flotilla, carrying food and medicine for Gaza, consisted of over 40 civilian vessels with around 500 people onboard, including parliamentarians, lawyers, and activists. It was about 70 nautical miles from Gaza when Israeli forces moved in.

  • Videos shared by passengers on Telegram showed individuals holding their passports, saying they had been abducted and taken to Israel against their will. They stressed the flotilla’s mission was peaceful and humanitarian.

  • Organisers condemned Israel’s “illegal” raid as a “war crime,” saying troops used aggressive tactics, including water cannon, but reported no casualties. They also said Israel disrupted their communications, including live camera feeds from the boats.

  • Israel said the flotilla was heading into an active combat zone and breaching a lawful blockade. Officials claimed aid could be transferred safely through established channels.

  • On Telegram, flotilla organisers reported that vessels named Spectre, Alma and Sirius, among others, were boarded in international waters. The fate of several passengers remains unclear.

  • Turkey’s foreign ministry described the Israeli “attack” as “an act of terror” that put civilian lives at risk. Demonstrations erupted across Italy in response.

  • Turkey said it had started efforts to secure the release of Turkish nationals and other detainees. Spain urged Israel to guarantee the rights and safety of the activists, while Ireland described the flotilla as “a peaceful mission to shine a light on a horrific humanitarian catastrophe.”

  • Ship tracking data indicated at least 13 vessels had been intercepted or halted by early Thursday. Organisers vowed to continue, saying the flotilla “will continue undeterred.”

  • Thirty boats were still on course towards Gaza, with organisers reporting they were 46 nautical miles from their destination early on Thursday.

title: Ex-UK diplomat says Israel’s flotilla raid breaches international law
summary:
Ex-UK diplomat says Israel’s flotilla raid breaches international law

Craig Murray, a former senior British diplomat, has accused Israel of acting outside international law in its raid on the Gaza aid flotilla.

“The flotilla is on the High Seas and not in Israel’s 12 mile territorial sea. Israel has no jurisdiction,” Murray wrote on X.

Murray previously led UK delegations on maritime law at the United Nations and stressed that “an attack by a state military warship on a vessel on the High Seas is an attack on the flag state of the vessel attacked.”

He warned that the “possession of vessels and the abduction of crews” at sea amounts to crimes that can be prosecuted not only under international law but also in domestic courts.

“So the Metropolitan Police and DPP [Director of Public Prosecutions] have an obligation to investigate and act over the abduction of persons from UK flagged vessels on the High Seas,” he said.

“This applies to each flag state mutatis mutandi,” Murray added.

title: Katz: IDF has nearly encircled Gaza City, residents have ‘last opportunity’ to leave
summary:
Medical sources in Hamas-run Strip report at least 35 killed by Israeli fire, mainly in Gaza City; IDF downs rockets fired from northern Gaza, including projectiles launched amid Yom Kippur

The post Katz: IDF has nearly encircled Gaza City, residents have ‘last opportunity’ to leave appeared first on The Times of Israel.

title: Hamas said split on whether to back Trump’s plan to end Gaza war, seeks amendments
summary:
Sources both within and close to terror group say Hamas is pushing to change clauses on disarmament and timing of hostages' release, which are Israel's key demands for ending the fighting

The post Hamas said split on whether to back Trump’s plan to end Gaza war, seeks amendments appeared first on The Times of Israel.

title: On Yom Kippur, the faint hope of a ‘good conclusion’
summary:
There is no shortage of clear-headed grounds for pessimism. But right now, perhaps more than at any time in the past two years, there is at least a concerted effort to change the terrible new normal

The post On Yom Kippur, the faint hope of a ‘good conclusion’ appeared first on The Times of Israel.

title: Tehran and Islamabad call for further regional peace, security
summary: Iran and Pakistan emphasized the necessity of cooperation in the international arena to cement bilateral relations.

title: Iran condemns Israeli attack on Gaza aid flotilla as ‘act of terror’
summary: Baghaei described the Israeli attack against the civilian-led convoy as a “blatant violation of international principles” and “an act of terror.”

title: Global protests as Israeli forces intercept 13 vessels from Gaza aid flotilla
summary: The Global Sumud Flotilla, comprising over 40 boats and nearly 500 participants, including parliamentarians, lawyers, and activists, is the most high-profile symbol of opposition to Israel’s blockade of Gaza.

title: Security Council remains paralyzed in the face of the Gaza crisis: Iran
summary: Iran's Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the United Nations said that the "crimes of the Zionist regime" are an example of genocide and crimes against humanity.

title: Iranian ambassadors in Berlin, Paris and London attend Foreign Ministry meeting
summary: A consultative meeting between the Foreign Minister and the ambassadors of the Islamic Republic of Iran to Germany, France, and the United Kingdom was held at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Tehran.

title: Defense Minister: Expanding Iran-Turkey defense relations is effective in solving challenges
summary: In a meeting with his counterpart in Turkey, Iranian Minister of Defense and Armed Forces Support said while referring to Iran's position in the Islamic world and the international arena, that expanding defense and military relations with this country could be effective in solving the challenges of the Islamic world and the region.

title: Iran calls for accountability of Israeli regime at ICAO international meeting
summary: Iranian representatives at the ICAO World Summit, while presenting their paper, condemned the Zionist regime's aggression against the civil aviation infrastructure of the Islamic Republic of Iran during the 12-Day War.

title: Iran and Japan start new chapter in scientific cooperation
summary: Iranian Minister of Science, Research and Technology met and held talks with the Japanese Ambassador to Iran on the eve of his trip to Japan to participate in the 22nd session of the Science and Technology in Society forum (STS).

title: Qatar ready to boost trade and customs exchanges with Iran: Envoy
summary: The Qatari ambassador to Iran announced plans to enhance bilateral customs relations, including a data exchange agreement.

title: Iran seeks to enhance defense ties with Turkiye: Minister
summary: Iran's Defense Minister visited Turkiye to strengthen defense relations and discuss border security.

title: Expediency Council agrees to Iran’s conditional accession to the CFT
summary: The CFT involves investigating, analyzing, deterring and preventing sources of funding for terrorist activities.

title: Iran calls for comprehensive sanctions on Israel over Gaza genocide
summary: Iran's Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the United Nations Office in Geneva emphasized the undeniable evidence of genocide in Gaza and the complicity of Western governments in Israeli crimes.

title: Birth anniversary of Imam Hassan al-Askari (AS) in Birjand
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – The birth anniversary of Imam Hassan al-Askari (AS) was celebrated in Birjand, South Khorasan province, on Wednesday night with the participation of different walks of life.

title: Esteghlal lose to Al Muharraq: 2025/26 ACL Two
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – Iran’s Esteghlal lost to Al Muharraq 1-0 in Matchday 2 of the 2025/26 AFC Champions League Two on Wednesday.

title: Demonstrations in support of Global Sumud Flotilla
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – Demonstrations in support of the Global Sumud Flotilla take place across Europe. Protests in Berlin, Brussels, Rome, and Istanbul are shown in social media footage.

title: Iran, Pakistan FMs discuss bilateral ties, regional peace
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and his Pakistani counterpart Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar held a telephone conversation on Thursday to discuss bilateral ties and the latest regional developments.

title: IRGC vows deadlier response to enemy's renewed aggression
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – In a statement on anniversary of True Promise II retaliatory operation against Israeli regime, the Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) declared that the enemy will receive dealdier response to its potential aggression.

title: 'Israel' detains 223 activists aboard intl. aid flotilla
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – Israel’s navy on Friday night began to intercept the large flotilla attempting to break its maritime blockade on the besiged Gaza Strip, arresting 223 activists aboard the international aid flotilla.

title: Iranian, Turkish defense ministers discuss cooperation
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – Iranian Defense Minister Brigadier General Aziz Nasirzadeh met with Turkish National Defense Minister Yaşar Güler in Ankara on Wednesday night to discuss bilateral cooperation in the field of defense.

title: Iran condemns attack on Sumud aid flotilla as a terrorist act
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 02 (MNA) – The Iranian foreign ministry spokesman has described the Zionist Israeli regime's attack on the aid flotilla known as Sumud as a terrorist act which comes in violation of international laws.

title: Hezbollah still respectful of Lebanon's truce with 'Israel'
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 01 (MNA) – "If Hezbollah is not taking action now, it is because it does not want to breach the ceasefire the Zionist regime has with Lebanon, otherwise it has the power to change the course of actions," according to Iran's Ali Larijani.

title: Over 200,000 protesters in Brussels march for Palestine
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 01 (MNA) – Approximately 200,000 people took to the streets in Belgium to call for an end to the genocide in Gaza.

title: Spanish PM urges Israel to not pose threat against flotilla
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 01 (MNA) – Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on Wednesday called on Israel not to pose any threat to the Gaza-bound Sumud Flotilla, stressing the mission is humanitarian and that those on board would have "full diplomatic protection."

title: Death toll from Ethiopia scaffolding collapse rises to 36
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 01 (MNA) – The death toll from a wooden scaffolding collapse in Ethiopia's Amhara Region has risen to 36, local officials said on Wednesday.

title: دده جانی: بازرسی زنجان با حساسیت موضوع سرویس مدارس را پیگیری می‌کند
summary: زنجان- بازرس کل استان زنجان گفت: هیچ‌گونه کوتاهی در زمینه سرویس مدارس پذیرفتنی نیست و بازرسی کل استان با حساسیت بالا پیگیر اجرای این موارد است.

title: صادقی: ۲۰۰۰ تن سیب زمینی روانه بازار مازندران می شود
summary: نور- سرپرست جهاد کشاورزی شهرستان نور از برداشت و عرضه گسترده سیب‌زمینی خبر داد و گفت: ۲ هزار تن محصول در نور روانه بازار می شود.

title: فهیمی: تصمیمات مهم برای مغان با حضور مقامات کشوری اتخاذ خواهد شد
summary: اردبیل – نماینده مردم پارس‌آباد، بیله‌سوار و اصلاندوز در مجلس شورای اسلامی گفت: سفر مسئولان کشوری به دشت مغان جهت اتخاذ تصمیمات مهم با هدف توسعه این منطقه در حال انجام است.

title: نهمین شماره نشریه «خردورزی» از راه رسید
summary: نهمین شماره نشریه «خردورزی» در ۲۹۸ صفحه با محوریت فلسطین منتشر شد.

title: ترور نافرجام بشار اسد در مسکو
summary: رسانه‌ها از ترور نافرجام رئیس جمهور سابق سوریه در پایتخت روسیه خبر دادند.

title: سارقان خانه‌های نیمه ساز یزد دستگیر شدند
summary: یزد- رئیس کلانتری ۱۴ ابوذر شهرستان یزد گفت: با تلاش ماموران کلانتری ابوذر یزد سارقان خانه‌های در دست ساخت شهرک طوبی دستگیر شدند.
